creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
inscription:
UR: 猛虎出林行，咆哮取人食 / 居人慮虎至，荊棘掛牆壁。/ 虎乃愛其身，驚遁不近側 / 人或虎不如，甘心蹈荊棘。/ (The fierce tiger ventures from the forest, roars, and eats the people.
The people ponder how to face the tiger, and put thorns along the fence. / The tiger does not want to get hurt, and escapes. / Whether human or tiger, only a fool would willingly hurt himself. *宋·徐照《猛虎行》)
markings: URC: 法無法(Hōmuhō); ULC: 伍草 (Gosōshi); ULC: 巌印 (Iwao in)
signed: ULC:  維時戊子之夏七月端午節擬板橋筆意 (Seventh month, 1888, in the style of Hankyō)
title: Tiger
